gyro_sync_denom.title: Gyro Sync Denominator
gyro_sync_denom.desc: Sets the gyro update frequency based on dividing the max loop rate (8kHz). `4` means `8kHz/4 = 2kHz`. Loop time is the reciprocal (`1/Rate`). Don't forget to check CPU usage when playing with this value. It is recommended to set the gyro update frequency in BF Configurator, this takes care of all the required settings. This value also affects the PID loop #pid_process_denom.

gyro_lowpass_type.title: Gyro Low Pass Filter 1 Type
gyro_lowpass_type.desc: TODO: Type of gyro dynamic lowpass filter. Maybe also static lowpass filter type if not using dynamic filter.

gyro_lowpass_hz.title: Gyro Low Pass Filter 1 Cutoff Frequency
gyro_lowpass_hz.desc: TODO: I think this is only used if not using dynamic filter.

gyro_lowpass2_hz.title: Gyro Low Pass Filter 2 Cutoff Frequency

gyro_overflow_detect.title: Gyro Overflow Detect
gyro_overflow_detect.desc: Axis where gyro overflow detection applies. Intended to deal with overflow issues on ICM gyros. The default is to be on, for all axes. It is unwise to disable this if your quad has an ICM gyro. It is not needed or helpful for MPU gyros. ICM gyros are susceptible to overflow-inversion problems if exposed to very high turn rates. If enabled and set to `ALL`, overflow protection will kick in and disable all PIDs whenever any axis exceeds 1950 degrees/second.

yaw_spin_recovery.title: Yaw Spin Recovery
yaw_spin_recovery.desc: This feature reduces the severity and duration of un-commanded severe yaw spins. For example, if a quadcopter clips a gate, tree, branch or other object and causes a high rate yaw spin, it may go into a 'never-ending' uncontrollable spin. Typically it makes a distinctive warbling noise and climbs rapidly - the so-called Yaw Spin To The Moon (YSTTM) problem. Yaw Spin Recovery is intended primarily for FPV pilots, and works best with MPU gyros. LOS acro pilots who use high yaw rates may prefer to disable this function.

yaw_spin_threshold.title: Yaw Spin Threshold
yaw_spin_threshold.desc: The 'threshold' value is the spin rate, in degrees per second, at which the spin protection kicks in. The default threshold of `1950` was chosen to minimise false triggering. For FPV, a lower value, e.g. 100-200 above your maximum configured yaw rate, is recommended. For example, a quad with a maximum configured yaw rate of 700 degrees/sec: Too low a threshold may cause false triggering, and delay return to normal control.

gyro_to_use.title: Gyro To Use
gyro_to_use.desc: TODO: Selects the gyro(s) that should be used.

dyn_notch_range.title: Dynamic Notch Filter Range
dyn_notch_range.desc: The dynamic notch has three frequency ranges in which it can operate: `LOW` (80-330hz) for lower revving quads like 6+ inches, `MEDIUM` (140-550hz) for a normal 5 inch quad, `HIGH` (230-800hz) for very high revving 2.5-3 inch quads. `AUTO` option selects the range depending on the value of the Gyro Dynamic Lowpass 1 Filter's max cutoff frequency.

dyn_notch_width_percent.title: Dynamic Notch Filter Width Percentage
dyn_notch_width_percent.desc: This sets the width between two dynamic notch filters. Setting it at 0 will disable the second dynamic notch filter and will reduce filter delay, however it may make motor temperatures higher.

dyn_notch_q.title: Dynamic Notch Filter Q
dyn_notch_q.desc: Q factor adjust how narrow or wide the dynamic notch filters are. Higher value makes it narrower and more precise and lower value makes it wider and broader. Having a really low value will greatly increase filter delay.

dyn_notch_min_hz.title: Dynamic Notch Filter Minimum Frequency
dyn_notch_min_hz.desc: Defines the lowest dynamic notch center frequency below which the dynamic notch will not go.

dyn_lpf_gyro_min_hz.title: Gyro Dynamic Low Pass Filter 1 Minimum Cutoff Frequency
dyn_lpf_gyro_min_hz.aka: Gyro Lowpass 1 Dynamic Min Cutoff Frequency [Hz]

dyn_lpf_gyro_max_hz.title: Gyro Dynamic Low Pass Filter 1 Maximum Cutoff Frequency
dyn_lpf_gyro_max_hz.aka: Gyro Lowpass 1 Dynamic Max Cutoff Frequency [Hz]

acc_hardware.title: Accelerometer Hardware
acc_hardware.desc: This is used to suggest which accelerometer driver should load, or to force no accelerometer in case gyro-only flight is needed. Default `AUTO` will attempt to auto-detect among enabled drivers. Otherwise, to force a particular device, set appropriately, or select `NONE` to disable accelerometer alltogether - resulting in gyro-only operation.

acc_lpf_hz.title: Accelerometer Low Pass Filter Cutoff Frequency

acc_calibration.title: Accelerometer Calibration
acc_calibration.desc: TODO: Accelerometer calibration values. Normally set automatically by pressing *Calibrate Accelerometer* in BF Configurator.

align_mag.title: Magnetometer Alignment
align_mag.desc: When running on non-default hardware or adding support for new sensors/sensor boards, these values are used for sensor orientation. When carefully understood, these values can also be used to rotate (in 90deg steps) or flip the board.

mag_hardware.title: Magnetometer Hardware
mag_hardware.desc: Set default `AUTO` to use magnetometer hardware defined for your board type. Otherwise select appropriate device, or set to `None` to disable magnetometer.

mag_declination.title: Magnetic Declination
mag_declination.desc: Magnetic declination of your current location in `dddmm` format. For example, `-6deg 37min` = `-637` for Japan. Leading zeros not required. Get your local magnetic declination here: http://magnetic-declination.com/

baro_hardware.title: Barometer Hardware
baro_hardware.desc: Set default `AUTO` to use the barometer hardware defined for your board type. Otherwise select appropriate device, or set to `None` to disable barometer.

baro_noise_lpf.title: Barometer Low Pass Filter Cutoff Frequency
baro_noise_lpf.desc: Barometer low-pass filter cut-off frequency in Hz.

baro_cf_vel.title: TODO: Barometer CF Velocity
baro_cf_vel.desc: Velocity sensor mix in altitude hold. Determines the influence accelerometer and barometer sensors have in the velocity estimation. `1000` for pure accelerometer altitude, 0 for pure barometer altitude.

mid_rc.title: RC Stick Center
mid_rc.desc: The value (in us) used to determine if a stick is centered.

min_check.title: RC Stick Low Threshold
min_check.desc: The maximum value (in us) for a stick to be recognised as low. Used for stick commands and #pid_at_min_throttle.

max_check.title: RC Stick High Threshold
max_check.desc: The minimum value (in us) for a stick to be recognised as high. Used for stick commands, etc.

rssi_channel.title: RSSI Channel
rssi_channel.desc: Receiver (RX) channel (AUX channel + 4) that contains an RSSI signal.

rssi_offset.title: RSSI Offset
rssi_offset.desc: GUESS: Offsets the RSSI value by a given amount.

rssi_invert.title: RSSI Inversion
rssi_invert.desc: GUESS: Inverts the RSSI value (high value = poor signal, low value = good signal)

rssi_src_frame_lpf_period.title: TODO: RSSI Source Frame Low Pass Filter Period

rc_interp.title: RC Interpolation
rc_interp.desc: TODO: This feature can cause the CPU to work harder to be able to run higher d setpoint weights and get cleaner motor outputs. Set to `OFF` if CPU loading is too high. Note: Auto RC interpolation detects RX speed based on the reported speed by RX itself. But some receivers can report 9ms interval while it is actually 18ms on roll and pitch when using more channels than 8.

rc_interp_ch.title: RC Interpolation Channels
rc_interp_ch.desc: TODO: Smoothing of RX inputs for Roll, Pitch, Yaw, Throttle.

fpv_mix_degrees.title: TODO: FPV Mix Degrees
fpv_mix_degrees.desc: Camera tilt angle in degrees that should be compensated for when enabling *FPV Angle Mix* mode. It can be used to fly FPV as if the camera was tilted differently. Also known as uptilt compensation.

serialrx_provider.title: SerialRX Provider
serialrx_provider.desc: When feature `SERIALRX` is enabled, this allows connection to several receivers which output data via digital interface resembling serial.

spektrum_sat_bind.title: TODO: Spektrum Sat Bind
spektrum_sat_bind.desc: Used to bind the spektrum satellite to RX. Set `0` to disable.

spektrum_sat_bind_autoreset.title: TODO: Spektrum Sat Bind Automatic Reset

airmode_start_throttle_percent.title: TODO: Airmode Start Throttle Percentage
airmode_start_throttle_percent.desc: As a safety feature when having airmode enabled, it will not become active until you throttle up above this value in percent once. After that airmode will be active in the whole throttle range, until you disarm.

rx_min_usec.title: RX Minimum Pulse Length
rx_min_usec.desc: Minimum valid pulse length [usec]. Pulses shorter than minimum are invalid and will trigger application of individual channel fallback settings for AUX channels or entering stage 1 for flightchannels.

rx_max_usec.title: RX Maximum Pulse Length
rx_max_usec.desc: Maximum valid pulse length [usec]. Pulses longer than maximum are invalid and will trigger application of individual channel fallback settings for AUX channels or entering stage 1 for flightchannels.

input_filtering_mode.title: Input Filtering Mode
input_filtering_mode.desc: Filter out noise from OpenLRS Telemetry RX

blackbox_p_ratio.title: Blackbox P-Frame Ratio
blackbox_p_ratio.desc: Describes how many blackbox P-frames (delta) are written for every I-frame (absolute). This can also be defined as the ratio: `I-frame interval` / `P-frame interval`. It can be adjusted in BF Configurator with the *Blackbox logging rate* option in Hz.

blackbox_device.title: Blackbox Device
blackbox_device.desc: TODO: Device used for logging blackbox stats.

blackbox_record_acc.title: Blackbox Record Accelerometer
blackbox_record_acc.desc: Include accelerometer data in the blackbox logs.

blackbox_mode.title: Blackbox Mode
blackbox_mode.desc: Determines when to enable blackbox logging. E.g. flipping a switch or when testing motors in BF Configurator.

min_throttle.title: Minimum Throttle
min_throttle.desc: These are minimum values (in us) that are sent to ESC when armed. This should be set to a value that reliably spins the motors. You can choose a value by performing a motor test in BF Configurator, and increase the motor speed until the motor spins properly.

max_throttle.title: Maximum Throttle
max_throttle.desc: These are maximum values (in us) that are sent to ESC when armed. You can perform a motor test in BF Configurator to select this value. Usually the maximum of `2000` is fine. If you want less throttle you should not change this value, but instead use #throttle_limit_percent.

min_command.title: TODO: Minimum Command
min_command.desc: This is the PWM value sent to ESCs when they are not armed. It should be less than your BLHeli minimum throttle configuration, to stop motors from spinning. If ESCs beep slowly when powered up, try decreasing this value. It can also be used for calibrating all ESCs at once.

dshot_idle_value.title: Motor (DShot) Idle Throttle Value
dshot_idle_value.desc: This is the *idle* value of throttle that is sent to the ESCs when the craft is armed and the throttle stick is at minimum position. Specified in percent * `100`, i.e. `500` equals `5` percent of maximum throttle.

dshot_bidir.title: Bidirectional DShot
dshot_bidir.desc: Bidirectional DShot. When enabled lets the DSHOT protocol receive information directly from the ESC, needed by the RPM Filter and other features. This requires custom firmware on BLHELI_S or the latest BLHELI_32 firmware.

motor_pwm_rate.title: Motor PWM Rate
motor_pwm_rate.desc: TODO: Output frequency (in Hz) for motor pins. Defaults are 400Hz for motor. If setting above 500Hz, will switch to brushed (direct drive) motors mode. For example, setting to 8000 will use brushed mode at 8kHz switching frequency. Up to 32kHz is supported. Default is 16000 for boards with brushed motors. Note, that in brushed mode, min_throttle is offset to zero. For brushed mode, set max_throttle to 2000.

motor_poles.title: Number of Motor Poles
motor_poles.desc: Represents the number of magnets that are on the bell of the motor. **Do NOT count the stators** where the windings are located. This setting is used for features such as the RPM Filter. Typical 5" motors have 14 magnets, smaller ones like 3" or less usually have 12 magnets.
motor_poles.aka: Motor poles (number of magnets on the motor bell)

failsafe_delay.title: Failsafe Stage 1 Delay
failsafe_delay.desc: Time for stage 1 to wait for recovery.
failsafe_delay.aka: Guard time for stage 2 activation after signal lost [1 = 0.1 sec.]

failsafe_off_delay.title: TODO: Failsafe Stage 2 Delay
failsafe_off_delay.desc: Time in deciseconds to wait before turning off motors when failsafe is activated. See Failsafe documentation.

failsafe_throttle.title: Failsafe Throttle Level
failsafe_throttle.desc: Throttle level used for landing when failsafe is enabled. See Failsafe documentation.

failsafe_switch_mode.title: Failsafe Switch Mode
failsafe_switch_mode.desc: This option determines what happens when Failsafe is activated through AUX switch: `Stage 1` activates Stage 1 failsafe. This is useful if you want to simulate the exact signal loss failsafe behavior. `Stage 2` skips Stage 1 and activates the Stage 2 procedure immediately. `Kill` disarms instantly (your craft will crash).

failsafe_throttle_low_delay.title: Failsafe Throttle Low Delay
failsafe_throttle_low_delay.desc: Just disarm the craft instead of executing the selected failsafe procedure when the throttle was low for this amount of time.

align_board_roll.title: Board Alignment Roll Axis
align_board_roll.desc: Assigns how the flight controller board is aligned on the roll axis.

align_board_pitch.title: Board Alignment Pitch Axis
align_board_pitch.desc: Assigns how the flight controller board is aligned on the pitch axis.

align_board_yaw.title: Board Alignment Yaw Axis
align_board_yaw.desc: Assigns how the flight controller board is aligned on the yaw axis.

gimbal_mode.title: Gimbal Mode
gimbal_mode.desc: TODO: When feature `SERVO_TILT` is enabled, this can be either NORMAL or MIXTILT

bat_capacity.title: Battery Capacity
bat_capacity.desc: Capacity of the battery in mAh. Can be used with #current_meter to detect remaining battery capacity. Leave at `0` to disable.

vbat_max_cell_voltage.title: Maximum Battery Cell Voltage
vbat_max_cell_voltage.desc: Maximum voltage of a single cell in the battery. Used for battery PID compensation #vbat_pid_gain, so be sure to set accordingly if enabling this option.

vbat_full_cell_voltage.title: Full Battery Cell Voltage
vbat_full_cell_voltage.desc: TODO: Voltage of a single cell in battery to be considered fully charged. I think used for warning if battery is not fully charged.

vbat_min_cell_voltage.title: Minimum Battery Cell Voltage
vbat_min_cell_voltage.desc: Minimum voltage allowed for a single cell in the battery. Warnings can be issued with beeper and OSD if this happens.

vbat_warning_cell_voltage.title: Battery Warning Cell Voltage
vbat_warning_cell_voltage.desc: Voltage of a single cell in the battery that should issue a warning, which can be detected with beeper and OSD.

vbat_hysteresis.title: TODO: Battery Hysteresis
vbat_hysteresis.desc: Sets the hysteresis value for low-battery alarms, in 0.1V units, i.e. 1 = 0.1V. The alarm will only go off if the voltage dips this amount below the warning voltage. Can be used to tame alarms that go off too easily with sagging batteries etc.

current_meter.title: Battery Current Meter Source
current_meter.desc: TODO: The `VIRTUAL` current sensor, once calibrated, estimates the current value from throttle position.

vbat_lpf_period.title: Battery Voltage Low Pass Filter Period

ibat_lpf_period.title: TODO Battery Current Low Pass Filter Period

vbat_scale.title: Battery Voltage Scale
vbat_scale.desc: TODO: Result is Vbatt in 0.1V steps. 3.3V = ADC Vref, 4095 = 12bit adc, 110 = 11:1 voltage divider (10k:1k) x 10 for 0.1V. Adjust this slightly if reported pack voltage is different from multimeter reading. You can get current voltage by typing "status" in cli.

beeper_dshot_beacon_tone.title: Beeper DShot Beacon Tone
beeper_dshot_beacon_tone.desc: Adjusts the tone of the of the DShot beacon. Higher value equals a higher tone frequency.

yaw_motors_reversed.title: Motor Direction Reversed
yaw_motors_reversed.desc: Configures the mixer to expect the motor direction to be reversed and the propellers to be on accordingly, in order to perform correct yaw movement. Warning: This does not reverse the motor direction. Use the configuration tool for your ESCs or switch the ESC motor wiring order to achieve this. Also known as *Props Out* configuration.

3d_deadband_low.title: 3D Low Throttle Deadband
3d_deadband_low.desc: TODO: Low value of throttle deadband for 3D mode (when stick is in the 3d_deadband_throttle range, the fixed values of 3d_deadband_low / _high are used instead)

3d_deadband_high.title: 3D High Throttle Deadband
3d_deadband_high.desc: TODO: High value of throttle deadband for 3D mode (when stick is in the deadband range, the value in 3d_neutral is used instead)

3d_deadband_throttle.title: TODO: 3D Neutral Throttle Deadband
3d_deadband_throttle.desc: TODO: Throttle signal will be held to a fixed value when throttle is centered with an error margin defined in this parameter.

servo_pwm_rate.title: Servo PWM Rate
servo_pwm_rate.desc: Output frequency (in Hz) servo pins. When using tricopters or gimbal with digital servo, this rate can be increased. Max of 498Hz (for 500Hz pwm period), and min of 50Hz. Most digital servos will support for example 330Hz.

servo_lowpass_hz.title: Servo Low Pass Filter Cutoff Frequency

tri_unarmed_servo.desc: On tricopter mix only, if this is enabled, servo will always be correcting regardless of armed state.

rateprofile_name.title: Rate Profile Name
rateprofile_name.desc: Name of the rate profile. Can be displayed in OSD using #osd_rate_profile_name_pos.

thr_mid.title: Throttle Midpoint
thr_mid.desc: Throttle Mid. The #thr_expo is centered around this point. Usually this is set around the hovering point.

thr_expo.title: Throttle Expo
thr_expo.desc: Throttle Expo. Creates an exponential throttle curve around the #thr_mid point. Used to increase throttle resolution, usually to support more fine-grained hovering.

tpa_rate.title: TPA Rate
tpa_rate.desc: Throttle PID Attenuation rate. How much to reduce PID gains when throttle is beyond #tpa_breakpoint. Used to eliminate fast oscillations at high throttle.

tpa_breakpoint.title: TPA Breakpoint
tpa_breakpoint.desc: Throttle PID Attenuation breakpoint. The point at which TPA should take effect. This should be set around the throttle point at which fast oscillations would occur.

tpa_mode.title: TPA Mode
tpa_mode.desc: Throttle PID Attenuation mode. Determines which PID gains should be reduced. Used to be both P and D, but by default only D since Betaflight 4.0.

throttle_limit_type.title: Throttle Limit Type
throttle_limit_type.desc: Select how #throttle_limit_percent should limit maximum throttle. `OFF` disables the feature. `SCALE` will transform the throttle range from 0 to the selected percentage using the full stick travel (linear throttle curve). `CLIP` will set a max throttle percentage and stick travel above that will have no additional effect.

throttle_limit_percent.title: Throttle Limit Percentage
throttle_limit_percent.desc: Sets the desired maximum throttle percentage, according to #throttle_limit_type.

roll_rate_limit.title: Roll Rate Limit
roll_rate_limit.desc: Maximum velocity (deg/s) for roll. Caps a roll rate curve that would otherwise become higher.

pitch_rate_limit.title: Pitch Rate Limit
pitch_rate_limit.desc: Maximum velocity (deg/s) for pitch. Caps a pitch rate curve that would otherwise become higher.

yaw_rate_limit.title: Yaw Rate Limit
yaw_rate_limit.desc: Maximum velocity (deg/s) for yaw. Caps a yaw rate curve that would otherwise become higher.

reboot_character.title: Reboot Character
reboot_character.desc: Special character used to trigger reboot.

imu_dcm_kp.desc: TODO: Inertial Measurement Unit KP Gain.

imu_dcm_ki.desc: TODO: Inertial Measurement Unit KI Gain.

small_angle.title: Maximum Arming Angle
small_angle.desc: Craft will not ARM if tilted more than specified number of degrees. Only applies if accelerometer is enabled. Setting to 180 will effectivly disable check.

auto_disarm_delay.title: Automatic Disarming Delay
auto_disarm_delay.desc: Automatically disarm multicopter after this delay in seconds of zero throttle. Disabled when `0`. The `MOTOR_STOP` feature must be enabled for this to take effect.

gps_auto_config.title: Automatic GPS Configuration
gps_auto_config.desc: TODO: Enable automatic configuration of UBlox GPS receivers.

gps_auto_baud.title: Automatic GPS Baudrate Detection
gps_auto_baud.desc: Enable automatic detection of GPS baudrate.

deadband.title: RC Pitch and Roll Deadband
deadband.desc: These are values (in us) by how much RC input can be different before it's considered valid for roll and pitch axis. For transmitters with jitter on outputs, this value can be increased. Defaults are zero, but can be increased up to 10 or so if rc inputs twitch while idle. This value is applied either side of the centrepoint.

yaw_deadband.title: RC Yaw Deadband
yaw_deadband.desc: These are values (in us) by how much RC input can be different before it's considered valid for the yaw axis. For transmitters with jitter on outputs, this value can be increased. Defaults are zero, but can be increased up to 10 or so if rc inputs twitch while idle. This value is applied either side of the centrepoint.

pid_process_denom.title: TODO: PID Process Denominator
pid_process_denom.desc: Determines PID and motor write frequency by dividing the gyro sample rate, determined by #gyro_sync_denom. This is automatically set to proper values when setting pid loop frequency in BF Configurator. The maximum frequency for the PID loop is limited by the maximum frequency that updates can be sent by the chosen ESC/motor protocol.

runaway_takeoff_prevention.title: Runaway Takeoff Prevention
runaway_takeoff_prevention.desc: TODO: Set this to OFF to completely disable the feature. Note that there will be no protection against runaway takeoff events and the firmware will behave as it did before the feature was implemented.

runaway_takeoff_deactivate_delay.title: Runaway Takeoff Deactivation Delay
runaway_takeoff_deactivate_delay.desc: TODO: This is the amount of successful flight time in milliseconds that must be accumulated to deactivate the feature. Valid values range from 100 (0.1 seconds) to 1000 (1 second). The default value of 500 (0.5 seconds) seems to be very reliable and shouldn't need to be adjusted. The goal is to deactivate the logic after a "reasonable" but short period of time once we've determined the craft is flying normally. However we want it to deactivate before we might reach the first point where a crash or other event may occur (like at the first gate during a race). Raising this value will delay the deactivation and it's possible that a crash or gate/branch clip could cause an unintended disarm. Lowering this value too much could result in the logic deactivating too soon and not providing protection in a runaway event. It's important to note that the delay is the accumulated amount of flight time where the other criteria like throttle level, stick activity, etc. are met. Thus the "real" elapsed time before deactivation may be longer than 0.5 seconds if the throttle was dropping below the limit or if the R/P/Y sticks were centered. The actual behavior can be viewed by using blackbox logging.

runaway_takeoff_deactivate_throttle_perc.title: Runaway Takeoff Deactivation Throttle Percentage
runaway_takeoff_deactivate_throttle_perc.desc: TODO: Determines the minimum throttle percentage threshold where successful flight can be considered. Valid values range from 0 to 100. Along with throttle level the logic also requires activity on the roll, pitch or yaw sticks along with the PID controller successfully controlling the craft with the PID_sum staying under control. When these conditions are met the logic accumulates successful flight time. Generally you won't need to adjust this value as most quads require around 25% or more throttle to takeoff/hover. The exception may be if you have and extremely powerful or light craft that is capable of flying well below 25% throttle. In this case you may want to lower this value closer to your actual hover throttle percent. If this value is set too low it's possible that the logic will deactivate too quickly and may not trigger in a real runaway event. Setting it too high will result in the logic taking more flight time to deactivate as it only accumulates flight time when the throttle is above the setting.

profile_name.title: Profile Name
profile_name.desc: Name of the PID profile. Can be seen in OSD using #osd_pid_profile_name_pos.

dyn_lpf_dterm_min_hz.title: D Term Dynamic Low Pass Filter 1 Minimum Cutoff Frequency
dyn_lpf_dterm_min_hz.aka: D Term Lowpass 1 Dynamic Min Cutoff Frequency [Hz]

dyn_lpf_dterm_max_hz.title: D Term Dynamic Low Pass Filter 1 Maximum Cutoff Frequency
dyn_lpf_dterm_max_hz.aka: D Term Lowpass 1 Dynamic Max Cutoff Frequency [Hz]

dterm_lowpass_type.title: D Term Low Pass Filter 1 Type
dterm_lowpass_type.aka: D Term Lowpass 1 Dynamic Filter Type

dterm_lowpass_hz.title: D Term Low Pass Filter 1 Cutoff Frequency

dterm_lowpass2_type.title: D Term Low Pass Filter 2 Type

dterm_lowpass2_hz.title: D Term Low Pass Filter 2 Cutoff Frequency

vbat_pid_gain.title: Battery Voltage PID Compensation
vbat_pid_gain.desc: Increases the PID values to compensate when battery voltage gets lower. This will give more constant flight characteristics throughout the flight. The amount of compensation that is applied is calculated from the #vbat_max_cell_voltage, so make sure that is set to something appropriate.

pid_at_min_throttle.desc: If enabled, the copter will process the PID algorithm at minimum throttle. With this `OFF` the PID controller does not respond to sticks when throttle values is below #min_check.

anti_gravity_threshold.title: Anti Gravity Threshold
anti_gravity_threshold.desc: To improve stability in fast changing G forces during flight. This applies to quick throttle jumps where multirotor can go through weightless transitions. In these cases the iterm can cause unwanted effects like pitching up or yawing due to strong changes in accumulation polarities.

anti_gravity_gain.title: Anti Gravity Gain
anti_gravity_gain.desc: Anti Gravity boosts the I term when fast throttle changes are detected. Higher gain values provide stability and better attitude hold when you pump the throttle.

feedforward_transition.title: Feedforward Transition
feedforward_transition.desc: With this parameter, the Feedforward term can be reduced near the center of the sticks, which results in smoother end of flips and rolls. The value represents a point of stick deflection: `0` - stick centered, `100` - full deflection. When the stick is above that point, Feedforward is kept constant at its configured value. When the stick is positioned below that point, Feedforward is reduced proportionally, reaching `0` at the stick center position. Value of `100` gives maximum smoothing effect, while value of `0` keeps the Feedforward fixed at its configured value over the whole stick range.

iterm_rotation.title: I Term Rotation
iterm_rotation.desc: Rotates the current I Term vector properly to other axes as the quad rotates when yawing continuously during rolls and when performing funnels and other tricks. This is appreciated by LOS acro pilots. For FPV the effect is fairly subtle but can result in somewhat more predictable responses during abrupt stick inputs and while performing tricks.

iterm_relax.title: I Term Relax Axes
iterm_relax.desc: TODO: Limits the accumulation of I Term when fast movements happen. This helps specially to reduce the bounceback at the end of rolls and other fast movements. You can choose the axes in which this is active, and if the fast movement is detectd using the Gyro or the Setpoint (stick).

yaw_lowpass_hz.title: Yaw Low Pass Filter Cutoff Frequency

throttle_boost.title: Throttle Boost
throttle_boost.desc: Allows throttle to be temporarily boosted on quick stick movements, which increases acceleration torque to the motors, providing a much faster throttle response.

acro_trainer_angle_limit.title: Acro Trainer Angle Limit
acro_trainer_angle_limit.desc: Adds an angle limiting mode for pilots who are learning to fly in acro mode. The mode must be activated with a switch in the modes tab.

level_limit.desc: TODO: The maximum allowed angle in degrees.

abs_control_gain.title: Absolute Control Gain
abs_control_gain.desc: To enable Absolute Control, set this to `10`, Smaller quads are ok with `5`. This feature solves some underlying problems of #iterm_rotation and should hopefully replace it at some point. This feature accumulates the absolute gyro error in quad coordinates and mixes a proportional correction into the setpoint. For it to work you need to enable AirMode and #iterm_relax (for `RP`). If you combine this feature with Integrated Yaw (#use_integrated_yaw), you can set #iterm_relax enabled for `RPY`. You should not enable absolute control and #iterm_rotation at the same time.

use_integrated_yaw.title: Integrated Yaw
use_integrated_yaw.desc: Integrated Yaw is a feature which corrects a fundamental issue with quad control: while the pitch and roll axis are controlled by the thrust differentials the props generate yaw is different. Integrated Yaw fixes this by integrating the output of the yaw pid before applying them to the mixer. This normalizes the way the pids work. You can now tune as any other axis. It requires use of Absolute Control (#abs_control_gain) since no I is needed with Integrated Yaw.

d_min_roll.title: D Min Roll
d_min_roll.desc: Controls the strength of dampening (D-term) in normal forward flight. During a sharp move or during prop wash, the Active D-gain raises to the Derivative gains (#d_roll).

d_min_pitch.title: D Min Pitch
d_min_pitch.desc: Controls the strength of dampening (D-term) in normal forward flight. During a sharp move or during prop wash, the Active D-gain raises to the Derivative gains (#d_pitch).

d_min_yaw.title: D Min Yaw
d_min_yaw.desc: Controls the strength of dampening (D-term) in normal forward flight. During a sharp move or during prop wash, the Active D-gain raises to the Derivative gains (#d_yaw).

d_min_boost_gain.title: D Min Boost Gain
d_min_boost_gain.desc: Adjusts how fast D gets up to its maximum value and is based on gyro to determine sharp moves and propwash events.

d_min_advance.title: D Min Advance
d_min_advance.desc: Makes D go up earlier by using setpoint instead of gyro to determine sharp moves.

motor_output_limit.title: Motor Output Attenuation Percentage
motor_output_limit.desc: Attenuates motor commands by the set percentage. Reduces ESC current and motor heat when using higher cell count batteries, e.g. for similar performance from a 6S battery on a 4S build, try 66%; for a 4S battery on a 3S build, try 75%.

auto_profile_cell_count.title: Automatic Profile Cell Count
auto_profile_cell_count.desc: Automatically activates the first profile that has a cell count equal to the connected battery.

frsky_vfas_precision.desc: TODO: Set to 1 to send raw VBat value in 0.1V resolution for receivers that can handle it, or 0 (default) to use the standard method.

ledstrip_visual_beeper.title: LED Strip Visual Beeper
ledstrip_visual_beeper.desc: TODO: When set to `ON`, and the LEDLOW mode is active (i.e. LED strip off), blink the LED strip in synch with beeping, as a visual indicator in cases where the craft is too far away for the beeper to be heard / multiple craft are flying.

osd_units.title: OSD Unit System
osd_units.desc: Sets whether to use the `Metric` or `Imperial` unit system for numerical readouts in the On Screen Display (OSD).

osd_profile_1_name.title: OSD Profile 1 Name
osd_profile_1_name.desc: Name of OSD Profile 1. Can be displayed in OSD using #osd_profile_name_pos.

osd_profile_2_name.title: OSD Profile 2 Name
osd_profile_2_name.desc: Name of OSD Profile 2. Can be displayed in OSD using #osd_profile_name_pos.

osd_profile_3_name.title: OSD Profile 3 Name
osd_profile_3_name.desc: Name of OSD Profile 3. Can be displayed in OSD using #osd_profile_name_pos.

rate_6pos_switch.title: Rate Six Position Switch
rate_6pos_switch.desc: Allows selection of all 6 rate profiles using a six position switch or pot. Normally, when configuring an adjustment channel for rate profile selection the channel value is divided into 3 ranges instead of 6.

cpu_overclock.title: CPU Overclocking
cpu_overclock.desc: Overclocks the flight controller CPU to run at a higher clock rate. It's recommended to only overclock if you have a CPU load higher than 50%. Overclocking can potentially overheat the CPU if not properly ventilated. Overclocking has previously been used to allow F4 FC to enable *Gyro 32KHz sampling mode* which was removed in Betaflight 4.0.

vtx_band.title: VTX Band
vtx_band.desc: The band (index) to be used by the VTX. You must configure the VTX Table and set up a VTX communication protocol such as SmartAudio for this to work.

vtx_channel.title: VTX Channel
vtx_channel.desc: The channel (index) to be used by the VTX within the configured #vtx_band. You must configure the VTX Table and set up a VTX communication protocol such as SmartAudio for this to work.

vtx_power.title: VTX Power Level
vtx_power.desc: TODO: The power level (index) to be used by the VTX. You must configure the VTX Table and set up a VTX communication protocol such as SmartAudio for this to work. It can be modified if Pit Mode or #vtx_low_power_disarm is enabled.

vtx_low_power_disarm.title: VTX Low Power Disarm
vtx_low_power_disarm.desc: When enabled, the VTX uses the lowest available power when disarmed (except if a failsafe has occurred).

vtx_freq.title: VTX Frequency
vtx_freq.desc: The frequency to be used by the VTX in MHz. Can be set directly if supported by your VTX, otherwise it is automatically set according to VTX table when you set #vtx_band and #vtx_channel.

vtx_pit_mode_freq.title: VTX Pit Mode Frequency
vtx_pit_mode_freq.desc: Frequency to use (in MHz) when the VTX is in pit mode.

vtx_halfduplex.title: VTX Half Duplex UART
vtx_halfduplex.desc: Use half duplex UART to communicate with the VTX, using only a TX pin in the FC.

vcd_video_system.title: VCD Video System
vcd_video_system.desc: Sets the expected analog color system used by the connected FPV camera. Typically this can be left on `AUTO`.

frsky_spi_bind_hop_data.title: Frsky SPI Bind Hop Data
frsky_spi_bind_hop_data.desc: GUESS: Data used to bind specific transmitter with receiver, using Frsky SPI protocol. This can avoid the need for rebinding, etc.

camera_control_ref_voltage.title: Camera Control Reference Voltage
camera_control_ref_voltage.desc: TODO: Voltage (in 10 mV steps) measured across your camera's floating OSD and GND pins, usually 3V3.

camera_control_key_delay.title: Camera Control Key Press Delay
camera_control_key_delay.desc: TODO: The duration of each key press (in ms presence at the camera_control pin, after consulting with RunCam it was set to 180 ms to accommodate most cameras, while some of them accept as low as 125 ms.

camera_control_internal_resistance.title: Camera Control Internal Resistance
camera_control_internal_resistance.desc: TODO: The internal resistance (in 100 Ohm steps) of your camera, most HS1177 derivatives have 47 kΩ, but that's not guaranteed. You'll have to derive this value for your camera in case the default one doesn't work.

usb_hid_cdc.title: USB HID/CDC Joystick Mode
usb_hid_cdc.desc: TODO: Allows using your flight controller as a USB HID joystick. Useful if your transmitter does not support HID. Support is currently only available on F4 / F7 boards.

gyro_1_sensor_align.title: Gyro 1 Sensor Alignment
gyro_1_sensor_align.desc: GUESS: Alignment of the first gyro sensor, represented as a rotation string. This seems to be closely coupled with the [gyro_1_align_*](#gyro_1_align_roll) variables.

gyro_1_align_roll.title: Gyro 1 Alignment Roll Axis
gyro_1_align_roll.desc: Assigns how the gyro sensor roll axis is aligned, independent of board alignment. This is updated by the *First GYRO* (#gyro_1_sensor_align) in BF Configurator.

gyro_1_align_pitch.title: Gyro 1 Alignment Pitch Axis
gyro_1_align_pitch.desc: Assigns how the gyro sensor pitch axis is aligned, independent of board alignment. This is updated by the *First GYRO* (#gyro_1_sensor_align) in BF Configurator.

gyro_1_align_yaw.title: Gyro 1 Alignment Yaw Axis
gyro_1_align_yaw.desc: Assigns how the gyro sensor yaw axis is aligned, independent of board alignment. This is updated by the *First GYRO* (#gyro_1_sensor_align) in BF Configurator.

gyro_2_sensor_align.title: Gyro 2 Sensor Alignment
gyro_2_sensor_align.desc: Like #gyro_1_sensor_align, but for the second gyro sensor.

gyro_2_align_roll.title: Gyro 2 Alignment Roll Axis
gyro_2_align_roll.desc: Like #gyro_1_align_roll, but for the second gyro sensor.

gyro_2_align_pitch.title: Gyro 2 Alignment Pitch Axis
gyro_2_align_pitch.desc: Like #gyro_1_align_pitch, but for the second gyro sensor.

gyro_2_align_yaw.title: Gyro 2 Alignment Yaw Axis
gyro_2_align_yaw.desc: Like #gyro_1_align_yaw, but for the second gyro sensor.

gyro_rpm_notch_harmonics.title: Gyro RPM Notch Filter Harmonics
gyro_rpm_notch_harmonics.desc: Number of harmonics per motor. A value of 3 (recommended for most quads) will generate 3 notch filters, per motor for each axis, totaling 36 notches. One at the base motor frequency and two harmonics at multiples of that base frequency.

gyro_rpm_notch_min.title: Gyro RPM Notch Filter Minimum Frequency
gyro_rpm_notch_min.desc: Minimum frequency that will be used by the RPM Filter.

dterm_rpm_notch_harmonics.title: D Term RPM Notch Filter Harmonics

dterm_rpm_notch_min.title: D Term RPM Notch Filter Minimum Frequency

rpm_notch_lpf.title: TODO: RPM Notch Low Pass Filter

name.title: Craft Name
name.desc: Name of the craft. Used in log and config files, and can be displayed in OSD with #osd_craft_name_pos.

display_name.title: Display Name
display_name.desc: Text that can be displayed in OSD with #osd_display_name_pos. E.g. name of the pilot.
